Sentencas: A reversible solid oxide fuel cell (RSOFC) system, consisting of a RSOFC stack, heat store, and electrical inverters to convert DC to AC power, is shown by computer modeling to have the potential to efficiently store electrical energy.
Titulo: Modeling a Reversible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell as a Storage Device Within AC Power Networks

Sentencas: This paper describes the modeling of a single RSOFC, based on a proposed cell geometry, empirical data on the resistivities of the components, and calculation of activation and diffusion polarization resistances from electrochemical theory.
Titulo: Modeling a Reversible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell as a Storage Device Within AC Power Networks

Sentencas: Data from ac impedance spectroscopy measurements on symmetrical cells are used to model RSOFC impedance.
Titulo: Modeling a Reversible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell as a Storage Device Within AC Power Networks

Sentencas: A RSOFC stack is modeled by electrically linking the individual cells inside a pressurized vessel.
Titulo: Modeling a Reversible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell as a Storage Device Within AC Power Networks

Sentencas: A phase change heat store is added to improve energy storage efficiency.
Titulo: Modeling a Reversible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell as a Storage Device Within AC Power Networks

Sentencas: The model is implemented in MATLAB (R)/Simulink (R).
Titulo: Modeling a Reversible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell as a Storage Device Within AC Power Networks

Sentencas: Two competing inverter control schemes are compared, trading off DC bus ripple against AC power quality.
Titulo: Modeling a Reversible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell as a Storage Device Within AC Power Networks

Sentencas: It is found that selection of appropriate DC bus capacitance is important in certain scenarios, with potential system cost implications.
Titulo: Modeling a Reversible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell as a Storage Device Within AC Power Networks

Sentencas: It is shown that the system can store electrical energy at an efficiency of 64% over a single dischargecharge cycle, i.e., hydrogen to electricity and heat to hydrogen.
Titulo: Modeling a Reversible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell as a Storage Device Within AC Power Networks
